Manager.description: So, the events for me of today: mild annoyance over some problems in the current stable ankidroid realize there hasn't been a stable ankidroid release since 2.0.1 in february check for the source and find out development has been ongoing try beta feature of play store, url doesn't work after login, throws 404 try to look at the source to see if i can compile it myself and to read up on the changes done in development search and finally find the tag of 2.0.1 to find out that development branches off on an earlier point and then devolves into absolute merge hell, making it impossible to actually read the change log in a sane manner spend two hours to rebuild history with cherry-picking and releasing I ended up with a history as you can see in: https://github.com/wchristian/Anki-Android Screenshot: https://www.dropbox.com/s/nic6el1lzzvfhze/ankidroid.png Not a single commit was changed in the rebase/cherry-pick process, they smoothly fit onto one another in a linear fashion. Aside from a single commit where the git algorithm made a mistake i didn't even have any conflicts. I cleaned the entire history going back to the point where current dev and 2.0.1 diverged, all in the space of two hours. The cost of implemeting this in actual ongoing development would be minimal, as it would be only a case of rebasing/cherry-picking the branches github reports as clean for merge. Additionally i'd happily volunteer to do the busywork and offer aid in helping others over any issues they might have with this. What do you say?
Manager.title: please consider changing to a development mode that does not involve creating merge commits

Manager.description: There is a personal Anki sync server available from here: https://github.com/dsnopek/anki-sync-server Users of the Anki desktop app can sync against it instead of AnkiWeb by creating a special add-on. However, AnkiDroid has the URL for AnkiWeb hardcoded! It'd be great to allow users to configure the URL of the sync server that they wish to use. There's already an issue for this on Google Code, but it was been marked as "WontFix": http://code.google.com/p/ankidroid/issues/detail?id=154 I'd like to re-open this discussion is possible. :-) I've been running a personal sync server based on this code on Bibliobird.com for almost 3 years (will be in December) and I've deployed it for client projects as well. The code's not perfect but it definitely works enough to be useful for many people! I'd be happy to help with code too, so long as I can get a little direction on where the maintainers think this should be in the application and if they'd even consider merging this feature. Thanks!
Manager.title: Allow users to configure the URL of the sync server

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 7 Embedding a sample deck would mean that random Market shoppers get a chance to see what it's about, and realize that they REALLY need it.
This sample deck would be proposed when opening Anki, as an alternative to using the browser to look for a deck.
This first page could look like this:
* Sample * Deck found in SD root * Other deck found in SD root * Deck found in SD /sdcard/anki * Other deck found in SD /sdcard/anki * Browse for other decks on the SD card.
A sample should be something everybody knows at least a bit, so it can not be a language or culture-specific thing.
Since spaced repetition is not implemented yet, it should not be too easy, otherwise people will find it is boring and wasting their time.
I was thinking about a country-capital set of about 30 middle-sized countries like Peru or Norway.
Of course, this deck should be internationalized together with the software, because Peru might be written Pérou or 秘鲁 or پیرو in other languages.
Anyone willing to write a small script to extract this as CSV from Wikipedia (or DBpedia, easier, if you are not afraid by SPARQL) ? Reported by nicolas.raoul on 2009-07-06 13:00:01
Manager.title: Embed a sample deck

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 19 When I use the desktop Anki, reviewing usually means pressing Space-Space-Space-Space-etc because Anki puts the focus on the button that will most probably be pressed (which is "remembered" for us).
The advantage is that answering is much faster, which leads to a more efficient use of the user's time. This is even more true for Android, because touching a zone on the screen is nowhere as fast as pressing a physical key. Especially in a crowded subway.
So I suggest putting the focus on "Remembered" automatically, and of course on "Show answer" too. Users will just keep clicking their phone's central button, and touch the screen just when they didn't remember. Reported by nicolas.raoul on 2009-10-20 05:15:11
Manager.title: Button focus

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 67 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open a deck. 2. Click "Answer". 3. Click "Easy" like crazy, as many times as you can.
What is the expected output? Next card is shown after a few seconds.
What do you see instead? AnkiDroid shows a spinning "Loading new card..." forever (or at least a long time, still spinning after 2 minutes)
The solution is probably to not take extra clicks into account, by having a "clicked" flag that is reset every time a new display is shown. Should ideally prevent one from clicking "Easy" and "Good" quickly after.
It seems unreasonable to click that much, but we can expect some users to do this, and yesterday it actually happened to me by mistake, I did not realized my finger was close to the screen and clicking repeatedly. Reported by nicolas.raoul on 2010-03-03 12:02:45
Manager.title: Answering like crazy makes AnkiDroid hang

Originally reported on Google Code with ID 105 I think the lack of this creates some confusion in AnkiDroid. In Anki it's hidden away under the advanced deck properties (defaults to 20). The review early functionality should sort most of the problem out of not been able to carry on reviewing.
Basically what happens is you set a huge number of new cards per day, unlimited session, questions etc. After answering lots of questions the "you've completed this deck message" comes up, even though you still have lot's of new questions to answer. If you look in the deck picker, it still says lots of cards are due, but you can't carry on with any cards. The reason: you've hit the maximum number of failed cards, but there's no where in AnkiDroid to see this so it's not obvious. Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 137 It would be nice if ankidroid could have a separate policy regarding whether cards with X tags are shown. The reason being that some cards you do want to see (on the desktop version), but for whatever reason do not want to see on the anki version (maybe you don't have headphones on, maybe sentences require too much time and you usually use ankidroid for a second here and there).
I recommend a page that displays tags similar to the "Inactive tags..." dialog in the desktop version.
The difference being the following:
- tags with a green background are shown on ankidroid and are registered the normal way as being shown (so the desktop version will show it)
- tags with yellow are not shown on ankidroid but if you sync the deck and use it on the desktop it will be shown
- tags with a red background are not shown on either ankidroid or the desktop version
And, tapping on the card will have it rotate among the various settings Reported by gwebmastertools@yahoo.com on 2010-07-30 05:16:03

This includes 10 new cards daily, which is how many new cards I want each day. 2. Synchronize the deck on my MacBook online. 3. Synchronize the deck on my HTC Evo with Ankidroid. 4. Review cards in Ankidroid. This again includes 10 new cards, which is 10 more than I want because I have already had 10 new cards with regular Anki.
What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I would like Ankidroid to be able to recognize when I have already gone through the new cards for the day, and not give me new cards if I have done so.
What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? I am using Anki 1.0.0 on Mac OS X 10.5.8 and Ankidroid 0.5alpha1 on my HTC Evo with Android 2.2.
Please provide any additional information below. Thanks for making a great piece of software! Reported by omalled on 2010-08-04 00:26:12
Manager.title: I get new cards twice per day

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 139 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Edit the default country-capitals file to have some style formatting, eg Question color set to red.
2. Save the new country-capitals file to a path other than the default one in the cellphone.
3. Open the country-capitals file in the default location (like from fresh install)
4. Change the deckpath to the one where the edited deck is found.
5. Switch to the country-capitals deck (now it's the new one)
What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I would expected that the new style would take effect. Instead the old one is used (black). If I kill AnkiDroid and start it again, then the new style takes effect as the Models hash maps are repopulated anew.
What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Anki 0.4.1, android 2.2, nexus one.
Please provide any additional information below. The issue raises the question of how fresh the values in a cache hashmap of Android applications. When the application is closed (paused in reality), it might restart several hours/days later with cached values that are really stale. I suggest we reset the Model caches during onResume() or onCreate()
Reported by inigo.aldana on 2010-08-04 17:18:09
Manager.title: Model hash maps not resetting upon change of deckpath

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 246 First let me apologize for not being able to pinpoint or describe this issue very well. I'll do my best.
This is more of a quirk than an issue. I've set the fonts and background colors on almost all of my models. I've noticed that these settings sometimes bleed into the models I've never adapted from the defaults. That is to say, that cards I'm expecting to have a black font and white background may have the color scheme of a previous card from a different model.
My theory, strange and uneducated as it is, is that this could be related to the fact that I formed almost all of my models at a COPY of another model. On my desktop Anki, I used to have problems with merging decks that had models that were copies of each other. I had split off some decks from my main deck and later decided to merge them back in. Even if I had changed the model names and attributes, it was like they somehow instinctually found each other once again when merged and started mingling, sometimes completely supplanting another model.
Part of that problem was that I was exporting the cards from the smaller decks by directly writing to bigger deck. Since then, that function has been disabled since it wasn't Damien's intention for the export function. I think now it would replace the entire deck, but back then, it added the exported cards to the existing deck. I only mention all of this in case it could be related to how the models are treated in the desktop software as well. In the desktop version I don't have this fonts/colors issue however. Reported by ottenlips on 2010-11-04 23:05:43
Manager.title: if background and font are not specifically set, the model can be influenced to show the wrong colors

Hi folks,
The wiki is a source of confusion to many users, who try to log in there to get to AnkiOnline, or to upload decks. Those categories would break the huge list into smaller lists that people would be able to scroll through quickly. What do you think about it?

Originally reported on Google Code with ID 346 Please consider adding a feature to "Bury" cards. This is a feature in the Desktop version that allows one to suspend a card solely until the next session.

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 396 This is an enhancement to the current error reporting tool to change it from an email to an HTTP post.
The post URL is defined in the constants.xml as error_post_url. It can't be localhost/127.0.0.1 since that points at the emulator.
The posted keys are all lowercase: reportsent; reportgenerated; device; host; availableinternalmemory; brand; versionname; time; androidversion; id; display; product; phonemodel; model; packagename; totalinternalmemory; board; stacktrace
See: http://groups.google.com/group/anki-android/browse_frm/thread/77c0ec95bd813ad1
Effecively this should close #338 as well. Reported by travis.watt on 2011-02-09 15:43:06

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 449 Today NorbertNagold kindly answered me about what represents the white part of the progress bars. Well, at the beggining I figured out this by myself, but something caused to me some confusion: two of my longest-rewied decks showed a white bar that occupied less of 10% of the total space of the bar, while the grey bar showed correctly nearly-completed. I checked the stat graphs, of cumulative due cards in 1 year, and they showed the information that should be represented by the white bar: almost 80% of the cards are mature, not merely a 10%.
So the first question that I have made to myself is: what makes different these decks from the others? I came easily to the answer: they are only small parts, activated by tags, of much larger decks, much of them disabled by tags. So, while the grey bar is based on the degree of completion of the tag-activated cards, I suspect that the white bar is showing information based on the whole deck, tag-activated or tag-suspended. I find this confusing, since the overlapping of the bars (white and grey) would rather suggest that the two draw information on the same basis, but I find they doesn't. Reported by Villatonil on 2011-02-21 15:54:59
Manager.title: Progress bars handling data inconsistently

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 458 Well, I know that TTS is a new feature, already "a child", but here's some suggestions for enhance it's usability in the future:
1. Choosing which fields should be read with TTS. Actually, there's only the option of choosing the language for TTS in each field, but there isn't any option of "discarding" TTS for one field. 2. Well, point 1 isn't totally true, since the "back" button can be pressed to discard TTS only for the present field. The problem is that this action isn't recorded for the rest of the session, and if we want one field without TTS, we must press "back" each time TTS attempts to read this field. 3. The option to activate TTS per deck. Some users have decks which they want to use TTS, and some they don't want.
So, in short: 1. A button of "discard" in the emerging menu of TTS language selection. 2. Recording of "discard" selection for the rest of the session. 3. Activate/deactivate TTS per deck.
Reported by Villatonil on 2011-02-23 09:39:20
Manager.title: Some adjustments for Text-to-speech

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 469 since a few days (two or three). I've experienced a very bad slowdown of AnkiDroid. It needs sometimes four or more seconds for a card to load.
I traced it back to this routine this line in Deck.java:
cur = getDB().getDatabase().rawQuery("SELECT value FROM deckVars WHERE key = '" + key + "'", null);
which is called by updateCard --> baseUrl = Utils.getBaseUrl(mMediaDir, myModel, currentDeck); --> if (deck.getBool("remoteImages")...
This rawQuery takes sometimes more thant four seconds to execute. the variable "remoteImages" does not exist in the deck-db and it seems as if sqlite needs very long to learn that. My db knowledge is poor, so I don't want to muck this about. Is this an index problem maybe and how can we solve it?
To my mind we should store the value anyway in a deck variable instead of performing always a db-operation for this value (which should be always the same).
It was probably introduced with the new fetch-images-code.
Reported by NorbertNagold on 2011-02-24 13:28:55
Manager.title: very slow card update

I'm not sure how to reproduce this, it's random and I only usually notice a few days after it happens. Usually there is no deck corruption.
I sync my deck on my phone normally after I finish all my reviews. Every few days I sync it with the Anki desktop client. Sometimes after I sync on the desktop client, I have an entire sync worth of cards that I've already answered in AnkiDroid, appearing as due reviews in the desktop client. So the situation is that I have 0 cards due in AnkiDroid and there is nothing to sync, and on the desktop client I have 20 (or whatever) cards due and also nothing to sync. So one of the syncs from AnkiDroid didn't work. The only way to fix it is to copy the deck from the sdcard over, answering the cards again in the desktop client and syncing with AnkiDroid sometimes does corrupt the deck.
My guess would be that Anki server is not committing the changes, and AnkiDroid is not handling the failed response properly/receiving a response and committing instead of rolling back. The only thing I can think of that may cause this is when I sync I sometimes have a rubbish signal, and my phone locks before the sync finishes. I may then only unlock my phone a couple of hours later, so exactly what Android does with this task, whether it tries to pause it or kill it, that may be the cause.

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 586 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a anki file with an underscore ("_") in the filename on a desktop computer. 2. Synchronize it to the server. 3. Download it in Ankidroid.
What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
To give an example: I create new_main.anki on my desktop pc, synchronize it to the Anki Server (new_main is created there) and then download it using the built-in download function of ankidroid. Here lies the problem: Ankidroid saves the file as "newmain.anki". The next time I synchronize with ankidroid a new database (newmain) is created on the server thus preventing successful synchronization between ankidroid and desktop versions.
Obviously not using underscores in filenames is a viable workaround ... so this issue probably has a low priority, but seeing that the filesystem of android as well as Ankidroid 'can' handle underscores (for example after uploading the "new_main.anki" to my phone manually) it might be something 'fixable' at some point. ;)
What version of AnkiDroid are you using? On what version of Android?
0.6 release version Reported by kai.ingolf.schmidt on 2011-04-23 09:57:14
Manager.title: Synchronization and handling of underscores in filenames

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 646 Just updated to 0.6 and am loving it. Some great updates to the UI, especially having statistics right on my phone. That was one of the few reasons I ever synced decks with the desktop.
I have a few feature ideas that I'd love to see added, some insired by the 0.6 changes:
1. It would be great when reviewing in addition to the daily/lifetime averages bars to have a bar that is for the current session. I do many sessions throughout the day, so the average becomes less useful later in the day.
2. Most of my decks are set to schedule reviews when they're due, so cards appear throughout the day. The deckview does not update, though. So currently to update I cycle from the current deck into the view of all decks to get AnkiDroid to update the cards to review. Sometimes I just press review which also checks for new cards. Could we get a button or menu item to update the deck status page with due cards? It would reduce the number of clicks and screen changes a lot.
3. One of my decks has >4000 cards, so starting the card viewer takes a long time. Maybe allow some kind of initial filtering or a "show first 50" to speed it up a bit?
4. It would be great if there were pinch gestures for zoom in/out on the statistics pages. The menu item takes too many clicks (and doesn't zoom enough).
Don't take the above as criticism. I lobe the app, and use it *all the time*. But these would make it so much better, at least for me.
Thanks for all your hard work.

Originally reported on Google Code with ID 660 This might be a misunderstanding on how settings work, or maybe a problem with Anki's scheduling, but here's the problem:
I have been experimenting with different scheduling algorithms. For one deck, I routinely fail new cards. I have set the button 1 delay to 30 minutes, so that the new cards should show up shortly after I first see them. At that point, I score them normally.
To do this, I've set the button 1 delay to 30 minutes and the show failed cards early to False (in Anki. This option isn't exposed in AnkiDroid).
The failed card delay seems to be working for non-new cards, but not with new cards. As I review new cards, the cards I just failed minutes before start showing up. And I can't stop them from showing up unless I give them a non-failure. This even if I've set new cards to appear before reviews.
Now maybe I'm just not understanding how this is supposed to work, but it seems like when you say you don't want failed cards to appear early, they shouldn't appear early, whether then next card should be new or not. Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 697 Norbert has suggested a tool to "fix" decks "tainted" by buggy HTC Sense phones: http://code.google.com/p/ankidroid/issues/detail?id=545#c41
How about creating a web application for this? I just created this project: https://github.com/nicolas-raoul/transdeck
Scenario: 1) User opens http://fixdeck.appspot.com in browser 2) User clicks on "Browse", select deck, submits 3) Servlet loads deck as an InputStream 4) Servlet fixes the deck using SQLJet or another SQLite library available on AppEngine 5) Servlet saves deck as an OutputStream 6) The user's browser receives the fixed deck and asks where to save it, directly as a response to the request in step 2
I implemented the general idea, and now it works if you upload for instance a simple text file. The hard work will now be to integrate SQLJet, which requires to implement this: http://code.google.com/p/sqljet/issues/detail?id=159
We could reuse this app for this: http://code.google.com/p/ankidroid/issues/detail?id=696 Reported by nicolas.raoul on 2011-08-01 12:34:09
Manager.title: Web app to fix decks broken by HTC Sense

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 856 The custom font support works really well, but I have one additional idea:
Sometimes, I would like to mix Western and Japanese scripts, for example in an “explanation” field. If I do this, I stumble across one of the following problems
1. No custom fonts for this field: I get a Chinese font for Japanese, but the right (=desired) font for e.g. German.
2. Japanese font for this field: Japanese is displayed properly, but German is ugly (because Japanese fonts usually don’t have nice latin glyphs).
So I wonder if it were possible to select custom fonts for complete scripts, regardless of the field. This could be done by comparing the value of a character with a list of characters used in one language.
For example, you have a data file “Japanese”, which lists all characters used in Japanese (Just use the current Shift-JIS list; so all Hiragana, Katakana, Kanji, punctuation marks etc). You have another list with Chinese and so on. In the settings of Ankidroid, you can then select “Japanese font: MS Mincho” or “Chinese font: PMingLiU”.
I guess this would not only be interesting for Chinese, Japanese or Korean, but also for other languages like Tibetan, Devanagari, Greek etc. - whereever one does not like the original font or where there is none provided by Android.
Additionally, I guess this would make it easier for most people who just want to have Japanese displayed with a Japanese font - copy a Japanese font onto the device, select it in Ankidroid and voilà. No need for fine tuning in Anki. Reported by gerritsangel on 2011-11-09 10:53:21
Manager.title: Custom fonts for different scripts, not restricted to fields

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 931 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Sync JPG files to Dropbox as image resources for a deck 2. "Download Missing Media" on AnkiDroid 3. Receive error "successfully retrived 0, missing 2" on Ankidroid
What is the expected output? What do you see instead? That the media would download, however it does not successfully download. See Additional Info.
What version of AnkiDroid are you using? On what version of Android? Market v1.0
Please provide any additional information below.
This is not technically an AnkiDroid issue, I believe. However, a solution may be able to be implemented in AnkiDroid if I am correct as to the cause.
1) I assume AnkiDroid verifies correct download of media via a checksum method of some type. 2) Many mobile carriers apply COMPRESSION to jpg images. T-Mobile does this. This is 100% beyond user control and is done on the network level. 3) Such compression will change the checksum of the file. 4) AnkiDroid will then see that the checksum of the file has failed when attempting to download it. 5) PNG files are not affected as compression is only applied to JPG files - this is confirmed as PNG resources download successfully.
Possible Solution: This solution is from Firefox, but may be applicable if done in AnkiDroid. Compression may be prevented (on T-Mobile at least) if the HTTP Headers for the request include specific values. Add the following 2 statements to the HTTP Get request: Pragma no-cache Cache-Control no-cache
I am not sure of the details of how this would be done, hopefully it's something not done in an external library and can be done easily enough. All I know is that adding these values on the desktop to the headers (via Firefox "Modify Headers" extension) will prevent compression of JPG images.
Reported by aelfwyne on 2012-01-04 18:50:41
Manager.title: Add HTTP headers to prevent JPG re-compression by mobile carrier

Originally reported on Google Code with ID 969 by greta.elisif:
I’d like night-mode with some options, especially since my eyes are very sensitive to bright light. I see some apps on my Kindle have a night-mode with white text on a black background. Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 978 Please explain your idea here.
Card browser tends to be awfully slow to both open and search with big decks (10000+ cards ends up in 20+ seconds loading, and ~5 second lags when typing text as it tries to update search results on the fly). This makes it a pain in the ass to edit/unsuspended any card (esp. when one has been suspended and I want to reactivate it, there is no other choice than go through card browser). IMO unsuspending or small editing a card through search is a frequent use case, and should be privileged over "browsing" this huge list of card.
Maybe for decks with more than 5000 cards, a different approach would be more useful: - Do not preload all the card in UI. Anyway, with 5000+ cards, user is never going to scroll them but stick with search. This will save 30+ seconds everytime I open it. Since there is a DB, search will still be fast with almost instant opening time. - Search results should not be updated at almost every keypress but maybe only user press a "search" button (or alternatively only if user doesn't input anything for a few seconds?).
In this end I hope those changes would make card browser much more usable. Reported by virgile.bello on 2012-01-30 15:16:43
Manager.title: Card browser for big decks (fast search/edit)

Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1013 This is related to http://code.google.com/p/anki/issues/detail?id=2928 .
I don't have a way to repro but maybe someone who knows the code will easily think why this happened.
I have a deck that I use only the phone but edit on the desktop. I suspended a card on the phone. After unsuspending on the desktop, it was in an inconsistent state that made it show over and over (see the bug above for more info).
Looking at an old back from before it was suspended I see
sqlite> select type, relativeDelay, priority, successive from cards where question like "%control%"; 1|1|2|8
which is all good.
Looking at the old backup on my phone I see
sqlite> select type, relativeDelay, priority, successive from cards where question like "%control%"; 1|0|-3|8
I think this is incorrect because when anki desktop unsuspends a card, it sets type=relativeDelay (decks.py:unsuspendCards). That gives the card a type=0 (which indicates a fail) but successive=8 (which indicates correct 8 times in a row).
I don't know how the 0 vs 8 happened. It probably involved me doing
1 fail card 2 undo fail so I can 3 suspend card

Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1104 Hi,
I have a very strange error in Ankidroid that I really don't understand. When I edit the keyword in my "Kanji - Jap" deck, the card somehow becomes associated with the wrong template. These are the precise steps to replicate -
In Ankidroid -
1. Open Kanji - Jap deck 2. Start the review 3. Select Edit card from Menu 4. Make any change to the keyword property 5. Save changes 6. You will be taken back to the review session, but the card will have flipped sides and will be using the template from the "Kanji - Eng" deck (presumably)
The only way I have found to fix this card at this point is to 1. Load the card in Windows Anki. 2. Edit the keyword and save 3. The card will flip back to the correct template.
I have uploaded the two decks (the only two decks I have loaded into Ankidroid). If you view the Kanji - Jap deck and have a look at the card with the keyword of "tranquillizes" you can observe that this card is flipped around the wrong way from the rest of the card. This is because I edited the Keyword in Ankidroid as above.
I am surprised this has not been picked up before because it seems a serious error, which makes me think it is just me. It has occured for me since I started using Ankidroid, and as a result I only can edit cards using Anki.
My specs Samsung Galaxy S2 Stock ROM LA4 Rooted Ankidroid 1.1 Android 2.3.6
Good luck with this one and thanks for your assistance!
Regards, Lloyd Reported by lloyd@lloydpowell.com on 2012-04-15 05:00:06 - _Attachment: [Kanji - Jap.anki](https://storage.googleapis.com/google-code-attachments/ankidroid/issue-1104/comment-0/Kanji - Jap.anki)_ - _Attachment: [Kanji - Eng.anki](https://storage.googleapis.com/google-code-attachments/ankidroid/issue-1104/comment-0/Kanji - Eng.anki)_

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1149 There are great shared decks for download which contain thousands of facts. You can sort them by "Created" so the easiest (or most common) words come first. This is a useful kind of sorting for such decks, learning the easy ones first and the more advanced later.
However, many of them contain the forward cards only. Using Anki Desktop, you can add the reverse cards easily. However, this means that all the reverse cards are created after the forwards cards. So, sorting by "Created", Anki would present you all forward cards before you can start with the newly created reverse cards.
The Desktop version solves this by having an additional sort option "Fact Created". Ankidroid is lacking this option. You can swap Q/A but you are correctly warned not to do so because it messes up the tracking of learning progress.
I could also imagine something like a "stick new cards of the same fact together" option which then works for all kinds of sorting. This option would be applied for selecting new cards only. After being presented to the user for the first time, the usual algorithms take over.
Reported by wolfgang.buecke on 2012-05-17 13:51:39
Manager.title: Group new cards by fact

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1156 In Preferences > Display, alongside "Show timer" and "Show progress bars", I'd really like the option to show / hide the "Remaining" card numbers: The Red, Black and Blue numbers which denote failed, pending and new cards for review.
The reason for this is that quite often looking to see which of the three piles the current card falls into (denoted by a line under either the red, black or blue number), gives me a hint as to whether I "should" know the card or not.
E.g., if my eyes flick up and notice I'm looking at a New card, I find I give up more easily, only to find that, when I look at the answer, it was something I would have got if I'd just tried a bit harder.
This is a problem reviewing on desktop Anki as well, but it's more of an issue on my phone, since the smaller screen means it's easier to glance at the numbers intentionally or otherwise. And since I do pretty much 100% of my reviewing on Ankidroid nowadays, it would be great if I could have the option to switch off this sneaky mental prompt!
Many thanks for such a great project! Reported by ryan.jendoubi on 2012-05-28 17:11:22

Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1180 This affects Egyptian hieroglyphics. It might also affect some CJK characters on the Supplementary Ideographic Plane, including some in modern use, but I haven't verified that.
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Install AnkiDroid 1.1.2 and Linux Anki 1.2.5. (I have no reason to believe that the specific version numbers or the desktop OS affect this.) 2. Download the Aegyptus font package from http://users.teilar.gr/~g1951d/ and install Gardiner.ttf in /sdcard/AnkiDroid/fonts and on the desktop. 3. On the desktop, edit a card model to use the "Gardiner" font a specific field, and insert U+1300 (a seated man). You can copy and paste from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egyptian_hieroglyphs#Unicode 4. Sink everything to AnkiWeb, and notice that it works fine from a desktop browser. 5. Sink everything down to AnkiDroid and review the card containing U+1300.
What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
You should see the same hieroglyphic character that you see in Anki desktop and AnkiWeb. Instead, you see six black diamonds containing a question mark and the hexidecimal number "FFFD".

Every time.

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1221 due to interdependencies with widget updating, the col fails sometimes to load when ankidroid is started. this happens when widget and normal collection loading occurs at the same time.
The widget checks if the collection is already open. If not, it opens the collection and closes it after having fetched the information.
When the widget opens the collection before the normal col loading start, deckpicker will just take the already opened collection and mark it as opened in order to prevent the widget from closing it.
That's the basic idea, but sometimes the widget nevertheless closes the collection although it's requested by deckpicker. In this case, deckpicker reports a db error.
The open collection method is a static synchronized method.
Any guess, why this happens? We should definitely solve this before releasing as it tells users about corrupt dbs which are actually not. Reported by NorbertNagold on 2012-07-16 21:06:11
Manager.title: sometimes collection is not loaded properly

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1259 First of all, sorry; I know this is related to issue 978, but I wanted to make a new thread specifically for the card browser on ankidroid2.
I have a deck with ~25,000 cards, and it takes ~10s to open the browser on my galaxy S2 (a fast phone!). There used to be an option to cache the card browser in memory but that doesn't seem to work anymore. In comparison Ankidroid 1 used to take around 60s for this particular deck, which is great, but it's still about 10x too slow for my tastes.
It was suggested in issue 978 that the loading time could be significantly reduced by simply not displaying all of the cards at first. This could be achieved either by automatically loading cards as they are scrolled into view (as per desktop), or by paginating the display for decks with large number of cards (I would say > 2000 cards).
Note that searching is MUCH faster than ankidroid1, to the point of not really being a problem IMO. However, performance could still be significantly increased by providing an option to turn off auto-search when typing.
Below is a bug report specifically for the cache option not working, but I personally recommend implementing the above suggestions instead, and simply removing the cache option which was not very user friendly to begin with.
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Turn on the card browser cache feature 2. Browse a deck with a large number of cards 3. Exit the browser 4. Open the browser again for the same deck
What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expect the deck to load instantly, or ask if I want to load from memory, as per previous versions of ankidroid. Instead it just does the same thing as before I checked the cache option.
Does it happen again every time you repeat the steps above? Or did it happen only one time? Everytime
What version of AnkiDroid are you using? Beta 8
On what version of Android? 4.0.3 Reported by perceptualchaos2 on 2012-07-26 01:56:59

Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1268 Using AnkiDroid v2.0beta9 on Android 2.2
Steps to reproduce: 1. Open a deck with some suspended cards. In the summary screen, the due count might indicate something like "Due today: 10 0 10". 2. Open the card browser and unsuspend a card, then close the card browser. 3. The line still reads "Due today: 10 0 10", when "10 0 11" is expected (if the card wasn't new).
This error follows through into reviewing: 4. Click "Start Reviewing". 5. The due count is now "10 0 9", which is neither of the two values from before. The unsuspended card does actually show up in the reviews, which means the due count can end up with negative numbers.
Bonus bug: If you have finished reviewing, and your due count is "0 0 0", then unsuspending some cards leaves your due count still as "0 0 0". This means when you click "Start Reviewing", your lesson ends immediately, even though you have some cards waiting to be reviewed since you just unsuspended them.
The due counts are corrected when you return to the deck picker screen. Reported by Houssam.Salem.Au on 2012-07-29 11:09:18

maybe there is already something that I'm looking for and I'm just blind, but here is my proposal: usually, when I learn with AnkiDroid, I don't learn just one deck, I want to learn all of them. Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1279 Hello,
although I am not necessarily against the Anki 2.0 design and don’t want to write anything bad before it is actually released, I am a bit confused.
When I enter a new card on Ankidroid, I can select “Note type” and get the type of other decks. I honestly don’t understand why I would need that. If I have a Japanese and a French deck, they have absolutely nothing in common, except that I use Ankidroid for learning them. Why would I select a Japanese note type when adding French vocabulary? This just bloats the entire list, in my opinion.
Also, if I already opened my Japanese deck, I can select the deck where the card is to be inserted. But when I already have the Japanese deck open, why would I want to insert it in the French deck? This makes sense when I add a card from the deck browser, but not when I already opened a deck. I think it just confuses.
I don’t know how the others feel, but for me, I liked the classic Anki method a little bit better. That now only one collection file is created is fine, but I think this method of shifting cards between different decks does not serve any purpose, if the decks have no logical connection to each other. So maybe it would be good if at least the models and the deck choice would not be shown anymore if I already opened a deck. For adding cards from the deck browser, this is fine, but I honestly don’t see the point when I’ve already opened one deck. Or maybe a classic mode would be nice (Although this would again add an item to the option menu, then making the options more confusing as they already are).
Reported by kh36717 on 2012-07-30 12:31:09
Manager.title: “Classic mode”

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1345 What steps will reproduce the problem? Not sure, happens during media syncing.
It means that after media syncing we have the wrong number of media files between ankiweb and AnkiDroid
Which means that at least one of the following cases is not handled properly by Ankidroid when media syncing: - Add a media file in anki, means that while syncing AnkiDroid didn't manage to create the file locally. - Delete a media file in anki, means that while syncing AnkiDroid didn't manage to delete the file locally. - Add a media file in AnkiDroid, means that after syncing the server the server didn't create the new file correctly. - Delete a media file from AnkiDroid, means that after syncing the server hasn't deleted the file.
The problem could be due to local FS issues not handled properly, or not sending the right instructions to ankiweb when syncing (eg asking to delete wrong filenames that don't exist).
Or due to hidden files in media folder not being picked up during syncing, but still counted in the sanity check.
In other words this needs lots of investigation.
It's currently the most frequent problem in beta16 and although it doesn't cause crashes, it triggers full media syncs which can consume a lot of bandwith both for the users and ankiweb.
So it needs resolving. Reported by inigo.aldana on 2012-08-28 12:28:12
Manager.title: Media sanity check failed. Counts are off.

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1419 Issue 778 and issue 1415 are related.
AnkiDroid currently seems to have its own feature for adding custom fonts, but that feature doesn't seem to work when the font is explicitly set for a current field already, and it relies on the filename for the font name instead of using the native font name.
Unlike Anki 1, Anki 2 documents a way to add fonts to the media folder. Not only will this also set the fonts up properly for the desktop, but it will ensure the fonts are included as part of a normal sync and means that no further setup is required on the mobile clients or web client. More info:
http://ankisrs.net/docs/manual.html#installingfonts
Two questions:
- does this work on AD already? If the html base tag has been set to the media folder, the AD webviews should be able to pick up the font automatically - is there any point to having the separate fonts folder on AnkiDroid now that such a feature exists? It seems silly to have to configure it more than once.

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1446 I've created a couple of cloze deletion cards for learning longer passages of text where two fields are used. Both fields include the same text. In the first field there are several clozes, to learn the text part by part. In the second field the whole portion of the text that I'm trying to memorize is put in a cloze. I'm usually learning those cards by suspending the last cloze (which includes the whole text) until I've learned the single portions and after some time unsuspending it again.
This works quite well in the desktop version of Anki2, but on the current beta version of Ankidroid those cards always show the content of both fields, one with the cloze working properly, the other showing the whole text (nothing blanked out), so I always see the answer, which is rather counter-productive.
I'm using the following syntax on those cloze deletion cards:
{{#Field1}}{{cloze:Field1}}{{/Field1}} {{#Field2}}{{cloze:Field2}}{{/Field2}}
Reported by isa.purzel on 2012-10-25 18:04:29

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1457 I think it would be nice to make it so that the user can make what buttons they want to cause what options they want.
For example, I find it is annoying having to take my finger from the stick to the D button, to display an answer. Surely it is much more ergonomic to make it so the user does not have to take their finger off the stick for each and every answer... What I recommend is to at least swap the A and D buttons, the A button is much easier to press, and with less effort. Pressing A at the moment plays audio. Not every deck has audio, but every deck has an answer, I don't see why playing the audio should 'benefit' from the larger, more accessible, better (in my opinion) button.
Combined with this, once the answer is displayed, having the A button trigger the recommended answer would be fantastic. Just like pressing space in desktop anki. The recommended answer exists in the code, I have made use of it personally in the beta 19 source.
Basically I think it would be good to swap button A and D in the reviewer, and to also let button A trigger the recommended answer. (Just how space acts in anki desktop, displaying the answer AND answering with the recommended choice) That, or, allowing us to edit the configuration of each zeemote button for ourselves, which would be much more work, which I don't think is as important.
Thank you very much :) Reported by woof.addict on 2012-10-30 11:10:19

Here's the SVG generation script, tex2png, that can either be added to $PATH or have latex.py point to directly: #! /bin/bash
pdflatex ./tmp.tex pdfcrop ./tmp.pdf pdf2svg ./tmp-crop.pdf ./tmp.svg rm ./tmp.{tex,pdf,log,aux,dvi} ./tmp-crop.pdf
You also have to change some lines in /usr/share/anki/libanki/anki/latex.py: latexDviPngCmd = ["tex2png"]
svg = namedtmp("tmp.svg")
if call(latexDviPngCmd,
shutil.copyfile(svg, os.path.join(mdir, fname))

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1477 Please explain your idea here.
The idea is to add an indicator on cards whilst reviewing which will inform the user if the card is marked and possibly what tags the card has (this last one is just something to consider).
The reason this should be implemented is simple; by not doing this, there is 0 point to even having "mark card" available as a gesture since in most cases on a large deck, it is difficult to remember what cards have been marked, and you thus have to refer to the menu to check, removing any ease of use benefits there might've been.
In an ideal world, we'd all instantly do something with our marked cards on the desktop version of anki right after marking them, but this isn't the case. I don't think I need to go into detail on what the actual indicator should be; it could be a little pink square at the top for all I care, so long as it's visible.
Thanks for your time and providing us this great tool. Reported by MrLeeBowling on 2012-11-12 21:07:15

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1524 Thanks a lot for all the time you've put into fixing the display problems for Hebrew vowels! It's already looking much better, but there are still some serious issues. I've mentioned everything I spotted but not all of the issues are equally serious.
I've create a small deck for testing: https://ankiweb.net/shared/info/2812525236.
CARD 1
The first card of the deck uses two fonts, which have been included in media and css via @fontface: "Ezra SIL" for the whole card and "Cardo" for the transcribed words (in green). I've taken screenshots on Win7 (Anki and AnkiWeb) and two Android devices (AnkiDroid and AnkiWeb): see attachments.
In summary: 1) Display on Anki: perfect. 2) Display on AnkiDroid: a) With Tohu.ttf (AnkiDroid workaround for Hebrew vowels): very good (but see below). b) Without Tohu.ttf: for some reason, on Android 4 (tablet), even though "Ezra SIL" is for the card overall, the Hebrew words are displayed in the system font. The vowel positions are reasonably good, better than on Android 2 (HTC Desire with Cyanogenmod), which uses "Ezra SIL" for the Hebrew words. 3) Display on AnkiWeb: a) Chrome on Win7: perfect. b) Dolphin on Android 2 (Cyanogenmod): perfect. c) Dolphing, Chrome or native browser on Android 4: same as 2) b) above.
Have you got any idea why 2) b) and 3) c) happen?
The other cards demonstrate some issues I have encountered with the AnkiDroid Tohu.ttf solution.
CARD 2
This card contains a list of all consonants and the main vowel-combination. Anki displays all correctly (except for pure vowels, which are only needed for grammar decks). But AnkiDroid has the following issues:
- Dageshes are not displayed correctly, especially for the narrow letters, but also for צּ and שּ. - Shevas and central, lower vowels (qames, hireq etc.) are not in the right position for גְ, דְ, וְ, זְ, יְ, ךְ, נְ, רְ - holem overlaps with לֹ
CARD 3
This card has a few lines of Hebrew text, which also includes accents. It shows that Tohu.ttf has inherited the Cardo.ttf-bug of overlapping lines. Also, it displays the line from bottom to top. And, in addition to the issues of card 2, it doesn't distinguish holem waw (the central letter in יוֹם) from waw+holem (וֹ).
CARD 4
This card demonstrates that AnkiDroid does reverse the order of letters or letter groups within words, if they are contained in span-sections (e.g. because they are highlighted in different colors).
CARD 5
This card demonstrates that AnkiDroid sometimes revereses the order of letters, if they are separated by dashes or spaces.

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1527 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Create a new deck within AnkiDroid; it'll only have 2 facts set. 2.Add some cards. 3.Import the deck to desktop Anki. 4.Adjust layout to have more facts as needed (3, for instance); this step probably "corrupts" the deck and I'll provide more details about this step below; I'll refer to the deck as "corrupted" later on. 5.Export the deck back to .anki file, overwrite it in AnkiDroid. 6.Try adding new cards for the corrupted deck (different ways tried - from within deck's main window and from cards browser). 7.See excuses about unfortunate stop. 8.Loop to step 6.
What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected is card edition window with 3 empty fields to type in. Crash dialog is seen instead.
Does it happen again every time you repeat the steps above? Or did it happen only one time? Every time for any "corrupted" deck.
AnkiDroid version: 1.1.3 Anki desktop version: 1.2.8 Android version: 4.0.3 (release5a), on Sony Tablet S
Please provide any additional information below. "Corruption" step details: additional fact was added, fonts, colors and font sizes were changed; new fonts were Glyph-oriented - MS Mincho, KaiTi (for aesthetic perception); exported deck shows all glyph characters on droid-device correctly, though fancy fonts are not working - it all casts down to plain Arial (I don't know, if AnkiDroid does the conversion, or the fonts are missing on my device, or the Android itself doesn't allow messing around fonts... Couldn't figure out). Now the corrupted deck may be edited - all existing cards are shown properly, one might browse them all and edit any facts as wished (though I havn't actually tried to save changes); the deck may be reviewed; nothing seems wrong until you try to add a new card - it crashes instantly. I tried to "fix" the corruption: opened the deck on desktop Anki, switched all fonts explicitly to Arial and exported it; it WORKED in 1 particular case - the deck containing just 1 single card was "cured" and now works fine. But this didn't "cure" my other deck with 68 cards; I finally had to convert it to plain tabulated text and re-import it to Anki desktop, loosing all schedule and layout info. This new re-assembled deck works fine currently on Ankidroid.

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1577 Anki 2.0 manual ("Changes in Anki 2") recommends the following method of selective study instead of tag-based one: ================================================== If you were using selective study to control introduction of new cards (such as blocking lessons 5-18 from being displayed), you could also convert each lesson into a deck, but that’s somewhat cumbersome. An easier method would be to suspend the cards you’re not ready for, and then unsuspend them on a per-lesson basis when you’re ready to study them. You could do it like this: 1. Search for "tag:lesson* is:new" to find all new cards with a lesson tag. Select them all, and suspend them. 2. Assuming you were halfway through lesson4 before upgrading, search for tag:lesson4 is:new" and unsuspend any cards that got suspended by the previous step. 3. When you’re ready to move on to lesson 5, search for "tag:lesson5" and unsuspend the cards. ==================================================
But using expressions like "tag:NNN" or "is:new" seems not working in AnkiDroid Browser. I also did not find interface elements like "Select all" and "Suspend".
How to suspend the cards I’m not ready for in AnkiDroid? If there is no way to do it in AnkiDroid, I'd like this to be added to the TODO list. Reported by Yu.I.Kornilov on 2013-01-07 14:35:14

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1639 Problem:
When using Anki to learn foreign language vocabulary, words in both languages can have multiple translations (polysemy), depending on meaning/context. This leads to possible duplicate values, and AnkiDroid will not allow the note to be saved.
In Anki Desktop, I created an additional "Context" field (*) which is displayed in a small font under the word to be translated. But I cannot edit this field in AnkiDroid because it disables the Save button when a duplicate value is detected.
Workarounds:
1. Only edit these cards in Anki Desktop (but most of the time that I spend with this deck, I am away from my desktop computer)
2. Add contextual information to the Front/Back fields (messy, adds formatting to field values, and you have to edit the description twice, restricts the full power of the field/note/template architecture)
Preferred Solution:
Add a new per-deck option for duplicate value checking, with three values: * DISABLED - no check * ENABLED - check for duplicate values and indicate by changing the text field style, but do not prevent saving the card * BLOCKING (default) - check for duplicate values, indicate by changing the text field style, and prevent saving the card (current behaviour)
(*) actually I created two direction-specific context fields, and one bidirectional field, and used conditionals in the card templates to decide what - if anything - to show.
Reported by andy.raffle on 2013-01-25 04:18:53
Manager.title: Add per-deck option to disable CardEditor.duplicateCheck()

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1671 Bug 3561092 has assigned 5 crashes that correspond to a different issue... or does it have 113 crashes with a different cause?
For crashes on 2.0, exception "android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabaseLockedException: database is locked (code 5): retrycount exceeded" was thrown,
In the same Bug, crashes 4067466, 3926164, 3929170, 3716036, 3563097, failed for "java.lang.IllegalStateException: database /mnt/sdcard/AnkiDroid/collection.anki2 (conn# 0) already closed".
Currently the signature is generated by looking into the offending line in com.ichi2.anki package, but between versions that is likely to be different code.
So, it could be improved by taking into account either: - The exception class, the message could contain variable data (paths, numbers), or - The stack of calls inside anki package (com.ichi2...). Ignoring the line numbers.
So for instance crash 4255054 has a signature: at com.ichi2.anki.AnkiDb.queryString at com.ichi2.anki.AnkiDb.closeDatabase at com.ichi2.anki.AnkiDatabaseManager.closeDatabase at com.ichi2.anki.DeckPicker.handleDbError at com.ichi2.anki.DeckPicker$40$1.onPostExecute at com.ichi2.async.DeckTask.onPostExecute at com.ichi2.async.DeckTask.onPostExecute
An crash 3926164 has signature: at com.ichi2.anki.AnkiDb.queryString at com.ichi2.anki.AnkiDb.closeDatabase at com.ichi2.anki.AnkiDatabaseManager.closeDatabase at com.ichi2.anki.DeckPicker.handleDbError at com.ichi2.anki.DeckPicker.onActivityResult
Hopefully that signature could be a little less version specific (i.e. the call chain of similar crashes in different version should be the same), and help to distinguish different crashes happening on the same line in different versions. Reported by ing.guillermo.zapata on 2013-02-05 18:53:08

A quick way to reproduce this is to open a deck, go to Options -> Reviews -> Space siblings by up to, then enter "4". After tapping "OK", you will notice the value is read back to you as "3".
Internally, that value, which is divided by 100, is being stored as 0.03999999910593033. When you sync and open the options on the desktop, that value is also parsed as 3 (but fixed when saved again).

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1792 Some flash card apps allow you to reverse the answer with the question. This feature is good, but a level better would be to have a bank of questions with slightly different wordings and therefore answers to choose from. Say we are studying a topic and have 10 questions to answer to cover that topic. There may be multiple ways of asking each (or some) of the questions. Say for example question 2 could be worded 3 different ways. We only want to see 10 questions or flashcards total, but when it gets to question 2 (whether working sequentially or in random order) it will randomly choose between the three options for that particular question. Giving the questions a tiered heirachy would allow this. Base questions could be integers while tiers could be designated (2A, 2B, 2C, etc) or be decimals (2.1, 2.2, 2.3, etc). Example: Q2A. When approaching a traffic light with a Red Signal, what action should you take? A2A. Stop.
Q2B. What colour would the traffic signal light be if you need to stop. A2B. Red.
Q2C. In what situation would you encounter a Red Light telling you to stop? A2C. When approaching an intersection controlled by traffic lights.
You would only need to answer one of the above questions to indicate your understanding of the Rule. But by having multiple questions that could be asked at this juncture in the question bank, makes revision more varied and less likely to be parrot fashion answers, but calculated. Reported by gavin.s.wellman on 2013-06-30 00:12:42
Manager.title: Alternate wording of same question.

Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1823 A polished timeboxing feature built right into anki would serve a lot of people quite well I think. This timebox would work by revealing the answer after x seconds, and then marking the card wrong after x seconds if the user presses nothing. Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1841 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Followed instructions from the Ankidroid doc here https://code.google.com/p/ankidroid/wiki/FAQ#How_can_I_use_custom_fonts?
and subsequently the main Anki docs to install custom fonts
What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected the font to display correctly but it didn't
Does it happen again every time you repeat the steps above? Or did it happen only one time? Yes, all the time.
What version of AnkiDroid are you using? (Decks list > menu > About > Look at the title) On what version of Android? (Home screen > menu > About phone > Android version) n/a
If it is a crash or "Force close" and you can reproduce it, the following would help immensely: 1) Install the "SendLog" app, 2) Reproduce the crash, 3) Immediately after, launch SendLog, 4) Attach the resulting file to this report. That will make the bug much easier to fix. n/a
Please provide any additional information below.
The issue is the instructions are not clear here: https://code.google.com/p/ankidroid/wiki/FAQ#How_can_I_use_custom_fonts?
because when one follows it to the letter the custom font is synced from computer to web to mobile device and went into the "/sdcard/AnkiDroid/collection.media" folder, which is where Anki computer stores it. Ankidroid, however, instructs us in the Preference->display page that custom fonts needs to go to /sdcard/AnkiDroid/fonts. So I manually copied the custom font file from /sdcard/AnkiDroid/collection.media to /sdcard/AnkiDroid/fonts and it worked.
I guess I don't know the reason behind this design but it almost makes more sense to put custom fonts under "/sdcard/AnkiDroid/collection.media" so Anki works consistently across platforms.
But I realize a code change is a big deal so if the docs could be amended to tell users this it might be helpful.
Thank you.

Manager.title: Documentation for custom fonts might need revision?

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 1892 Hello,
I'm a developer of the Acapela TTS Engine for Android. Some users reported that Ankidroid didn't work with our TTS.
So I did a look in the code and the main problem is that AnkiDroid doesn't wait that TTS is well initialised (TTS init is async) before trying to read a card. We did some improvement to speed up this but AnkiDroid really needs to wait TTS is initialised before trying to speak a card.
I did some code modification on Anki-Android-2.0.1 source code.
I cannot attach it here (quota exceeded) but please send me a mail or reply here and I will send it to you. Maybe this is not the right way to do it but this might help.
Modification made on ReadText.java et Reviewer.java
Regards,
Sebastien http://www.acapela-for-android.com Reported by acapela.group.android on 2013-11-19 14:47:57
Manager.title: TTS async init not waited

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2021 Suggestion to create an intent to call synchronization externally That is great to use with automation tools (tasker, llama)
Suggestion of Parameters:
Parameter: conflictResolution Description: How resolve conflict situations. Use other than cancel at your own risk! Options: - cancel (default, cancel the sync if conflited), - forceDeviceData (override server data with device data), - forceServerData (override device data with server data)
Parameter: preventOverloadDelay Description: A suggestion to prevent multiple calls to this intent. Buggy automation tasks can overload anki server, this parameter tries to reduce this issue. Maybe ankidroid can save last sync date. On intent call, it compares with this parameter: If actual sync date is earlier than (last sync date + overloadDelay), don't sync Options: integer value representing minutes (default 10 minutes)
From: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/anki-android/DXWCeJpATvU Reported by brunofelipe on 2014-03-12 12:46:33

Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2024 What steps will reproduce the problem? The following steps likely require a source deck with certain properties, namely a fair amount of new along with some due for review cards. 1. Create a filter deck from some deck, using default values. You want the resulting cram deck to either be all review cards, or at least have some review and some new. 2. Without reviewing a single card, go delete the cram deck (which may crash due to issue 2009, which has been addressed and will not be the cause of this issue) 3. Repeat steps 1 and 2 until eventually you have only new cards in the cram deck.
What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I would expect the exact same deck to be generated each time, with no changes. Instead, it is either handing me new cards (I don't know), or upon deleting the cram/filter deck it is changing the scheduling or some other property of the cards such that they appear new rather than as reviews. Perhaps, it marks cards as "seen", such that the default critera of oldest not seen is selecting a new set of cards, but, the cards have not actually been seen! So this would not be a proper result.

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2120 What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. First we need to have a database on AnkiDroid that differ in such a way from the database on AnkiWeb that a "Syncing Conflict" occurs.
2. Try to sync from AnkiDroid. Notice "Syncing Conflict" warning message.
3. Choose the option to replace the AnkiDroid database with the database from the server, AnkiWeb.
4. Now you will see the message "Full sync from server". And you can once again (without reviewing any cards) press sync. No complaint about "Syncing conflict" this time.
5. *However*, now review one card in AnkiDroid and then press Sync again. The "Syncing Conflict" warning message pops up again.
What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The expected output is that the AnkiDroid database should be fully consistent with the AnkiWeb version, even after one card review.
Instead the database seemingly differs again after full sync if you review one card.
Does it happen again every time you repeat the steps above? Or did it happen only one time?
Happens everytime with my current database.
What version of AnkiDroid are you using? (Decks list > menu > About > Look at the title) v2.1.3 on both tablet and phone.
On what version of Android? (Home screen > menu > About phone > Android version) 4.0.4 Galaxy S2 / Tablet
Please provide any additional information below.
* What solved the problem for me was that I reviewed a few cards on desktop Anki. Synced Anki. Then I successfully synced again on AnkiDroid. The only visible changes in AnkiDroid database was that the recently reviewed cards were correctly accounted for and removed from the review-queue.
To summarize: During the whole time I could successfully sync and review cards on desktop Anki. But even after doing a full sync on AnkiDroid on both my phone and tablet I could not review any cards without getting a syncing conflict warning message again. Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2152 There exists an Anki Desktop addon which resolves one of the fundamental problems with the current Anki scheduling algorithm: Card Due spikes on certain days. This addon checks amount of cards due and when a spike in the Cards Due is detected on a specific day, then adjusts the next scheduled review accordingly. The maximum amount of days forward or back to which cards can be pushed can be configured.
This feature is available in Anki Desktop as an addon: https://ankiweb.net/shared/info/1417170896
Note that it is one of the highest-rated and most-downloaded addons for Anki Desktop. Reported by dotancohen on 2014-06-13 16:30:07

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2165 What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Write a new card with a latex formula on pc, sync it 2. Sync android device, see that the formula is being properly displayed 3. Change the latex formula on pc again, sync it 4. Sync android device
What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
Android device should have the corrected latex formula, instead it does still show the old formula
Does it happen again every time you repeat the steps above? Or did it happen only one time? Every time.
What version of AnkiDroid are you using? (Decks list > menu > About > Look at the title) v2.1.3
On what version of Android? (Home screen > menu > About phone > Android version) 4.4.2
Please provide any additional information below. I suppose upon sync it is not being checked/recognized that the latex equation has been changed. So I would suggest either to check the picture data more accurately (size, date added / modified) or to give the card a new state "graphicChanged" or "LatexChanged" or similar.
Workaround for now: 1. Delete the latex equation on pc. 2. Sync pc. 3. Sync android device. 4. Add the new equation on pc. 5. Sync pc. 6. Sync android device.
Now the new formula should appear.
Reported by reinerheinerl on 2014-06-24 18:07:55
Manager.title: After sync between pc and android the old latex formula is displayed instead of an updated latex formula

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2200 Hi Team,
I love the app and been using it for 12 months.
In the last two updates the Statistics and Sync buttons were moved from the bottom of the main screen to the top of the screen, making Statistics a two touch menu operation to open, and also meaning user must use a finger to open the settings menu or click the sync button since thumb can't reach from bottom of screen to top of screen.
Hence my feature request to restore Statistics and Sync buttons to bottom of main screen, or at least an option in settings to have them appear at bottom of main screen, so that users can use single thumb click to press.
Another thing changed was that the Cancel and Save were buttons in Edit Card were reversed left and right, so that long term users can accidentally hit Cancel where they used to hit Save. Just a small annoyance, but please be wary of making such UI changes in future updates.
Cheers!
Peter Reported by peterjwhite71 on 2014-07-23 02:30:48
Manager.title: Option to restore Statistics and Sync buttons on main screen

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2347 Anki could be used as a knowledge base program (outliner) with tree structure. You would be able to put into it any information preserving its structure and order, such as a book consisting of nested sections. Then you could memorize each section of the book (note) separately using standard Anki methods. You could make one-field note for each section of the book and put the notes in a tree structure (outliner) preserving the hierarchy (structure) of the sections of the book. Doing so, you could read the book from the beginning until the end or study it memorizing separate sections of it (notes). The problems is that Anki does not allow building tree of notes. You can build a tree of tags but not notes. If somebody develops a plugin for it, Anki could become the best in the world knowledge base program (outliner) with a unique feature for such programs - possibility to memorize the contents. It would be nice to have such feature in AnkiDroid too. SuperMemo already has such feature: http://help.supermemo.org/wiki/Tree Though SuperMemo does not have Android version. As an example of an outliner, check the best outliner TreNotes (Windows and Android versions): http://discoverfuture.blogspot.com/2012/09/best-knowledge-base-programs.html

Manager.description: Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2402 It's pity I don't see an option for interleaved practice using Anki, which shows that people have +1/3 better results than using 'blocked' practice. In my case, I have a parent deck containing various sub-decks (this is for organization). When I study the Parent deck, however, the cards in the sub-decks are showed one-by-one, in a sense, until I finish all cards in deck X, cards in deck Y aren't shown. What if I wanted to study all cards in all decks, in random order? So suppose a card in deck X shows first, then a card in deck Z, then in deck Y etc. This is called interleaved/varied practice (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Varied_practice ) and there's PLENTY of research to support that this kind of practice produces better learning in the long-run. My question is: Is there a way to do this in Anki currently and if there isn't (or there is some hack) do Anki creators plan to do this for the near future (in 1-3 months maybe?) Spaced repetition is powerful enough for retaining knowledge, but interleaved practice is another amazing addition which enhances learning. And Anki is all about learning better, right? Reported by darko.twist on 2014-11-13 00:33:08
Manager.title: Adding more features for interleaved practice

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2496 (I'm not sure if it is a bug, but ...)
About "Cards due " notification number,
(a) When the deck list is being shown, it means "the number of the due cards of the collection at that time" .
(b) When a deck overview screen (or its study screen) is being shown, it means that (a) + "the number of the cards which are not ready to be reviewed in the deck"
(c) When the home screen of Android is being shown, it means (b). (To be more precise, (a) + "the number of the cards which are not ready to be reviewed in the last selected deck".)
(the number of the widget is the same as it.)
For example, a short time ago, the number of the notification on my AnkiDroid changed one after another as follows.
home screen (199)...(c)
--> deck list (190)...(a)
--> overview of deck "A" (199)...(b) (this deck has 9 cards which are not ready to be reviewed)
--> deck list (190)...(a)
--> overview of deck "B" (193)...(b) (this deck has 3 cards which are not ready to be reviewed)
--> home screen (193)...(c)
Is it intentional design?
Does it happen again every time you repeat the steps above? Or did it happen only one time?
every time
Version of AnkiDroid 2.4beta17
Version of Android 4.3
Reported by snowtimeglass on 2015-01-27 14:25:50
Manager.title: The number of "Cards due" notification isn't consistent?

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2511 What steps will reproduce the problem?
My database got corrupt today as usual (see issue #2484 discussion for context) during reviewing. AnkiDroid displayed a dialog asking me whether to close it or do something else. Simultaneously, on top of it, it displayed another dialog asking me to report an error and kept displaying it and reporting time and time again until I finally clicked "Cancel". Then I managed to click "Close" in the original dialog and close the application.
I have restarted the tablet and tried to run AnkiDroid again. It has shown the loading screen and immediately asked me to report an error. I did and then it just kept loading - I think it just hung. I tried it several times with exactly the same result.
When I rebooted again the application started properly despite the corruption. Curiously, the collection passed AnkiDroid's database check. When I restarted the application and tried again, it failed it as expected.
What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
If it gets an error on startup because of the corrupt database, it should display the "can't open collection" dialog and let me remove the collection or do a full sync. It should not get stuck on the loading screen.
I was advised never to touch the collection files because it can lead to corruption so I can't clear the database manually. If the application hangs on startup, the application becomes unusable without any way for me to get it back to a state from before corruption.
Does it happen again every time you repeat the steps above? Or did it happen only one time?
It was reproducible until I restarted again.
The reports I have sent should contain specific line in code and exception type. I hope it'll be enough to find out why the handler did not display the dialog and let the application hang instead.
Paste the "debug info" from the AnkiDroid "About" dialog below (see the above help webpage for detailed instructions).

Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2532 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create custom study limited to a particular tag that ends with ')' in fact it ends with '!)' if that makes any difference.
What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: Generates new filtered(? - don't think it's an actual deck) deck that includes notes matching selected tag Instead: Generates empty deck with no note. Says congrats, finished studying for today
Does it happen again every time you repeat the steps above? Or did it happen only one time? Every time
AnkiDroid Version = 2.4
Android Version = 5.0.2
ACRA UUID = efcb96f4-eceb-4e0f-a8c6-bbdc5546fa4e
/!\ ADDITIONAL INFORMATION /!\
The problem seems to come from the fact that the generated search field for the custom study limited to a particular tag doesn't have quotes around the tag: it goes:
deck:"Deck1" (tag:foo(bar) )
and fails, whereas it would succeed as:
deck:"Deck1" tag:"foo(bar)"
I don't know why there is an added space, I also don't know why it isn't:
deck:"Deck1" tag:"foo(bar)"
Maybe '))' acts like a specific syntax and the space is to avoid that, but it fails because ') )' registers as the same syntax?
anyway, it should be an easy fix. I would gladly do it but I'm not a developer. Reported by boidinf on 2015-02-17 22:43:52
Manager.title: Custom study by tag ending with ')' creates empty deck

Manager.description:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2666 Please explain your idea here.
The feature to mail off an exported apkg file is quite nice. While a) most (some) of the time people will use it to mail it to themselves, and b) when not they can type a message in the e-mail client, a bit of boilerplate¹ text would be nice. Something like "Hi, This is a flashcard deck, send from AnkiDroid. Try importing it into AnkiDroid or Anki vor desktop", with links to the two web sites, maybe a bit more self-promotion. The exact wording should probably be discussed in the forum.
Is this feature available on similar apps (Anki Desktop, AnkiMobile, AnyMemo, etc) ? If yes, it could help to include a screenshot or link to a page explaining the feature.
Web services that send automatic mails usually contain a bit of boilerplate. Look at the last “your password was changed" or "you signed up at XYZ" mail. One case where you get the chance to edit the text that still contains boilerplate is Firefox Hello (their video chat). You click on "Mail link" or something, and you get some standard text in your e-mail client.
¹ https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/boilerplate Reported by ospalh on 2015-06-29 08:15:52
